Name: New Imperialism
Description: Territory Acquisition board game. Has New Imperialism theme describing the historical period between 1875 and 1914 when the European great powers as well as new powers such as Japan and the USA were forging far-flung empires in a race for new markets, raw materials, and national prestige. Players recruit and move their units on a world map. Conflict is handled by a quick random method. Victory points are earned by having the most units in Seas and Colonies. Each great power has its own unique abilities and starting set-ups. An Event deck and Empire Deck provide tons of Chrome.

Name: Epic Space Empires
Description: Just the Epic Stuff!!! Quick playing Card game with a Space Empire theme. Timing and targeting are critical to combat. Use your Fleets to capture planets and defend them. a plethora of Worlds, Races, Governments, Technologies, and Fleet types all have a multitude of special traits and abilities with which to help you defeat your alien rivals.

Name: O Tannen-BOOM!
Description:
O Tannen-BOOM! is an explosively fun card game for 2-4 players.

Players seek to Build and decorate their own Christmas Tree while blowing the branches off of their opponent's! Best tree (or what is left of one) will go home with the prize!

On a player's turn they may draw cards, play cards (branches of your tree) or play Baubles/Bombs.  Players score points for sets of similar Baubles in a row.  Many cards also have additional actions that may be played upon adding them to your tree.

Bauble tokens are also your Bomb tokens so you must choose carefully whether to use them in decorating your tree (to gain points) or in blowing up your opponent's (to prevent them from doing the same).

This game was submitted as part of the 2010 Christmas PNP Game Design Contest.

Name: BattleTech: Record Sheets – 3085
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

MORE ’MECHS FOR THE BATTLEFIELD...

You’ve grasped the tactics involved with the additional units and weapons from Total Warfare to defeat your opponents. Now you own Technical Readout: 3085 and want to deploy some of those ’Mechs, vehicles, conventional infantry and Land-Air BattleMechs on your gaming table. Grab your dice and start rolling, because these sheets are for you!

Record Sheets: 3085 contains more than 65 pre-printed ’Mech record sheets that will have players firing autocannons, missiles and PPCs at each other in no time. More than twenty vehicle and conventional infantry sheets bring the excitement of combined-arms game play to any table top. Two ready-to-play scenarios focus on the highlights of this volume, while an extensive Rules Addendum section provides a sneak peak of all the advanced rules options provided in Tactical Operations. Finally, Land-Air BattleMech Quick-Start Rules allow players to instantly field these unique, Star League-era units.

Name: BattleTech: Jihad Hot Spots – Terra
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

Tearing Down the Walls!

For more than ten years, the Word of Blake’s Jihad has engulfed the states of the Inner Sphere and the invading Clans in chaos and fire. Reeling from attacks on all fronts, realms have fought one another while the Word’s masters built a powerful Protectorate around humanity’s home: Terra. But with the rise of a resourceful rebel leader, Devlin Stone, the collective might of the Great Houses and rival Clans have united for an all-out assault against the Protectorate - one that can only end when humanity’s home is free once again!

Jihad Hot Spots: Terra continues the Jihad plot book series started with Blake Ascending, bringing readers into the latter years of the war between the Word of Blake and the Inner Sphere. Seen from the eyes of those who fight and die in this epic struggle, this book includes articles and intelligence excerpts from across the Inner Sphere, along with additional rules and campaign tracks for both BattleTech campaigns played using the Total Warfare and A Time of War game rules. This book also provides a rare, in-depth look at the Terran system itself, including the history and varied cultures who live on these most revered worlds. Also included are rules and units for the elaborate defense network the Word of Blake unveiled against Stone and his allied Coalition throughout the Protectorate campaign.

Name: Corporate B.S.
Description:
"Sometimes success has nothing to do with skill." - Anonymous (as quoted on the front of the box)

The object of the game is to move up the corporate ladder to the penthouse suite and become the Chief Executive Officer of the company.

This game is essentially a roll-and-move race, with event cards and money and other twists to make it a bit more interesting.  Instead of rolling the die to determine how far you move, the roll determines which deck of cards you draw from. The card determines your move, usually by giving you a choice.  For example, here is a card from the "Personal Life" deck: "You suddenly get hit with two paternity suits.  Collect (2) enemychips and move back (3) or pay $2500."  Here's one from "Connections": "Your boss' spouse takes a liking to you at a company picnic.  Move up (2) or collect $500 and two friendchips."

Most turns you'll have to make a decision as to how to best balance your forward progress with your money, friends, and enemies.  Friend chips are awarded for various "friendly" events, and Enemy chips are earned for all the people you had to step on to raise yourself up.  Friendchips can be turned into $250 each if you can't otherwise make loan payments, or they can be used to move up one extra space.  Enemy chips can be bought off for $500, and you can't enter the CEO's office (and win the game) unless you have more friendchips than enemychips.  You also must enter the CEO's office by exact count, so it helps to have friendchips to adjust you movement as needed.

In addition, certain squares landed on indicate that a card from the "Outside Influence" deck is drawn.  These cards affect all players.  These events may refer to the department indicated on the board spaces.  The departments are "Sales," "Accounting," "Data Processing," "Manager," etc.  A card from the Outside Influence deck is: "A new simulator increases the productivity of the Technical Department.  All technical staff move up (3)."

Name: Kwintie
Description:
Kwintie is a strategical building game for 2 players. The objective of the game is to build a horizontal, vertical, or diagonal row of 5 square blocks.

The blocks that the players play with have the dimensions of 1 x 1 x 2. The blocks must be placed on a board consisting of a single row of 9 squares, or on top of one another. Blocks from one colour may not touch with their 1 x 1 sides (in other words, two pieces of one colour may not form a vertical or horizontal row  that is four cubes long). The first player to get 5 in a Row is the winner. If a player cannot move anymore, then he loses. For balancing purposes, the first move of the first player may not be touch the center field.

Name: R.U.M.B.L.
Description:
Gameplay:

A two player game in which each player commands a group of robots with special abilities. Some robots fly, some explode, some push, some create clones, etc. For three rounds each player will simultaneously select up to three robots to charge onto the game board from a dock that attaches to one edge of a game board.  The robots are given a power token which specifies how many spaces it can move and a priority token which specifies when a robot will move.  If you've successfully outguessed your opponent, you'll be able to claim the center of the board and score more points.  The team that has scored the most points at the end of three rounds is the winner.

From the rules:

By the year 2534, inefficient, unreliable human players of team sports have been replaced by machines, maximizing enjoyment for all.  To take advantage of the machines’ capabilities, new Robosports have been invented.

The third most popular sport on planet Earth after SPACECAR racing and Clone Professional Wrestling is RoboUltimateMechaBattleLeague, where the controllers try to program their team of robots to seize the middle of the playing field in three rounds of exciting robotic combat. To win a RUMBL, you must carefully choose among the special abilities of your robots, place them for maximum impact, anticipate your opponent’s moves, and ration your team’s power strategically. If you can do all this, you can rule the RUMBL!

Name: Chat' Trappe
Description:
From the box:
Can be fast as a cat of fast as a mouse?
In this cat trap game, you can be a cat to hunt mice or a mice to escape from a cat.
Choose a player to be a cat and players to act as a mice. Now roll the dice and act fast. Catch the right mouse or escape from the evil cat. Accomplish you mission and get a point.
Most points after every player has been a cat, is the winner.

Name: Global Cooling
Description:
from the publisher's website:

Global Cooling is an “energetic” family board game invented by Danes and produced in Denmark.

It’s all about placing as many Global Windmills on as many of the World’s 7 Continents as possible. To get the right to place a Global Windmill on one of the World’s 7 Continents you need to have been able to place a Forrest and a Windmill on your Lot.

You receive a salary each time you pass START including a bonus in case you have made wise environmental disposition! You need money to build up a windmill empire! You can increase your income and your chances of winning the game by investing in sustainable energy solutions such as buying an Electric car, Solar Panels for you House – or by winning in the Casino. If you are lucky you may even receive a contribution from the Global Cooling Foundation.

If you are in need for cash you may pawn your assets at any time. But be aware - it can be risky! The other players might get a chance to buy your pawned assets if they subsequently land on the Pawn square where you have placed your pawned assets.

You occasionally get the opportunity to draw so-called “Global Cards” which describe realistic climate and/or environmental scenarios giving you either an advantage or a disadvantage in the game.

Towards the end of the game there will often be a hectic race against the other players. The winner of the game is the player who first passes START having placed the most Global Windmills on the World Map - subject to all 7 Global Windmill having been placed on all the World’s 7 Continents – alternatively the player who first succeeds in having placed a total of 4 Global Windmills.

Name: Derringer
Description:
From the rulebook: "Derringer will take you to the saloon where honourable citizens sit at the table with dubious characters, playing Poker. ... When so much money is at stake, everything is possible. It happens that people help their luck using marked cards or another ace- but cardsharps are not welcome. Don't let them catch you or someone may grab a gun, and then the fastest shot decides rather than the best hand."

Derringer is a Poker variant where each of the oversized hand card shows one to three Poker cards. Rules follow those of five-card draw Poker, but you have to decide which cards to play. With the 5 hand cards several possible Poker card hands may be built. You play a bid round, a buy round and a second bid round. When it comes to show your hand, you play two hand cards (showing 5 or 6 Poker cards) or as many hand cards as necessary to play exactly 5 Poker cards. Double cards or playing 6 Poker cards counts as card-sharping; in this case other players can decide to play Derringer cards to shoot that player out of this round. Three additional special power cards are in the the deck, allowing special actions.

The game comes in two editions, "Maverick" and "Traveller". Traveller has the minimum equipment, and the bills are smaller und uncut, but it still comes in a veneer-wooden box. Maverick comes in a splendid wooden case, with larger and fully-cut bills and more Poker chips. Summary cards explain the special power cards and the Poker hand values

Name: Wild Pursuit!
Description:
Wild Pursuit is a race around the world to capture some of the wildest animals on the planet. Players compete to capture and tag different kinds of animals so that scientists can track their movements and protect their natural habitats. But it won’t be easy. You must have the right tools to capture them as well as the right gear to navigate the treacherous terrain. But be careful — these animals are wild and may fight back! As you play you’ll learn interesting facts about the animals and tools used to safely capture them. It’s a fun and sometimes dangerous strategy game for the whole family!

(No animals were harmed in the development of this game.)

This game features a unique board design that allows a different set-up each time you play. Together with the different card abilities and a random draw deck, you’ll have a different experience each time you play! - from the publisher of Wild Pursuit, Nightstalker Games.

Name: Chronicles of Zombie Town
Description:
From the publishers website:

A fun zombie-themed murder mystery party for ages 15 and up, 8-16+ guests. Non-gender specific - play co-ed, all female or all male! Expandable to over 40 guests with the main game by adding additional guests to play with the 3 expandable characters.

MYSTERY SYNOPSIS:
Three weeks ago, the cheery town of Sunnyville was hit hard with a devastating plague that turned the living into horrifying undead zombies. Once the H5N1 zombie virus spread and the zombie population dominated the living within Sunnyville, the zombies staged a revolt and took over the government. The Center for Disease Control, hearing of this epidemic centered in Sunnyville, quarantined the town and the U.S. Government threatened to 'wipe out' the population of zombies to prevent further spreading of this viral nightmare. But the citizens of the newly-formed Zombie Town weren't the stereotypical aggressive zombies portrayed in movies, television and comic books. The citizens of Zombie Town were simply dead and decomposing but still the same as before - upstanding citizens! But with one gruesome exception: the virus gave them an intense craving for living human flesh! Because a mandatory vaccine against the H5N1 zombie virus was given to the human population outside of Zombie Town and the epidemic ceased to exist, human rights activists caught wind of the situation in Sunnyville (aka: Zombie Town) and formed the Save a Zombie Alliance. Millions banded together across the country and persuaded the United States government to sign an unprecedented peace treaty with the zombies. Ashes, the self acclaimed Emperor of Zombie Town, represented the zombies and outlined the truce with the U.S. President. The major clause in the treaty was that zombies would not cross the borders of Zombie Town unless on an approved journey by the U.S. President and they would never hunt living humans for food outside of their borders. Because there were extensive warning signs posted for miles surrounding Zombie Town's borders, there was an addendum in favor of the zombies that if a living human ended up inside the borders of Zombie Town, they were 'fair game' to be hunted, captured and on a zombie's dinner table. Ashes set forth the laws of Zombie Town and the treaty was to be signed by both Ashes and the U.S. President within 24 hours. The citizens were happy to be at peace with the United States Government. Thankfully, they discovered they could sustain themselves by eating pumpkins but pumpkins didn’t quite satisfy their appetite for living human flesh. Suppressing their cravings led to increasing irritability and with frustrations escalating in Zombie Town, Ashes knew s/he had to pump up the morale of the citizens. Leary of an impending civil unrest, s/he scheduled the Undead Festival which was a massive town-wide celebration with delicious pumpkin-inspired food, rockin' music and fun zombie games. And this is where the story begins...

Name: Zooloretto: Glücksschwein
Description:
A post card format expansion for Zooloretto.
 Glücksschwein (Pig of luck) is won by filling the 6-space enclosure first. At the end of the game, the money of the owner of Glücksschwein is doubled. The player that first won the Glücksschwein keeps it for the rest of the game night's Zooloretto plays.

Home Page & Newsletter:

     www.zooloretto.com 


(German, english, dutch, hungarian, spanish, swedish)

Name: Homicide On Halloween at the Chamber of Screams Haunted House
Description:
An exciting Halloween Murder Mystery in a Haunted House setting for 8-16+ guests, ages 15+ (for challenge level). There are 4 expandable characters that can be played as teams - so this game can accommodate over 40+ guests! With the 5 character expansion pack, you can expand this game to over 75 guests! This game can be played as Co-Ed, all Female, or all male with one required female player.

The cast members of the Chamber of Screams Haunted House worked really hard this Halloween season scaring the people of the town. The management of the Chamber of Screams decided to reward the employees with a mini-Halloween celebration held during normal business hours in the employee break room. The Haunted House typically shut down each night for a brief time period so the employees could get a break and straighten up their haunted scenes. It was rumored that management probably did this so the line of customers outside would build up and The Chamber of Screams would look twice as popular. Regardless of the reason for the break, the employees looked forward to the upcoming treat during their next shift at work. The Halloween Celebration kicked off without a hitch as the frightening cast members piled into the employee break area and enjoyed delicious creepy appetizers and eerie drinks while quizzing each other on challenging spooky trivia. Unexpectedly, the lights went out and within a few minutes...to everyone's horror...a dead body was discovered!

The employees scrambled to figure out whodunit before the police arrived.

--from the publishers website

Name: Pandemonium On Plymouth Rock
Description:
From the publishers website:

A fun family Thanksgiving Day Murder Mystery Party for 7 to 10 guests, ages 13+. This is an extremely light-hearted and comical murder mystery for great family fun on Thanksgiving.

MYSTERY SYNOPSIS:
Hannah Standish sent the announcements for her annual Thanksgiving feast to the Pilgrims of Plymouth Village and the Native Americans of the Wompang tribe. The day of the feast arrived and the hungry guests flocked to the Standish home with their hands full of tasty dishes to be shared by all. The guests quizzed each other with fun trivia while nibbling on delectable appetizers. To everyone's surprise, representatives from a neighboring flock of wild turkeys also arrived on the scene to befriend the Pilgrims and Native Americans in hopes to stop the growing tradition of roasting a turkey on Thanksgiving Day. The turkey representatives gave it their best shot and pleaded with the humans to make a switch of the traditional Thanksgiving feast to cow, pig or maybe even fish as the main course. After the humans listened to the wild turkey’s pleas, they decided to give the turkeys 'temporary immunity' while they engaged in a fun game of 'What Thanksgiving Thing am I.' They continued with the challenging 'Football Mascot Challenge' before settling in for a nice Thanksgiving Dinner. But before they could dig into the Thanksgiving feast, a victim was discovered in the adjacent room! Murder on Thanksgiving?! Disastrous! The group rallied together to investigate whodunit before the murderer could get away! They took a quick break from the stress of the investigation and played some awesome games such as the 'Thanksgiving Scramble Challenge', 'Thanksgiving Bingo' and the hilarious 'So You Wanna Make a Turkey' challenge. Then, the guests one by one accused who they believed the murderer was and then to everyone's shock...the murderer confessed! The guests capped off the investigation with a hilarious game of 'Thanksgiving Charades' followed by a challenging 'Thanksgiving Word Hunt' game and then settled in for a delectable Thanksgiving feast! Overall it was most definitely a Thanksgiving that everyone will remember for years to come!

Name: Poor Knight
Description:
The Poor Knight is an educational card game that develops observance, planning and counting skills. Players learn to recognise geometrical forms, colors and their relationships and use the acquired skills in the game.

The game consists of four tournament rounds. During the first tournament there is one battle, in the second tournament two battles and so on. In total there are 1+2+3+4=10 battles from which players are trying to gather as many points as possible.

The gameplay is based around knight cards and battle cards. The battle cards give 1-2 pieces of information, for example heraldic animal and color. They're also worth points. The knight cards each have some info that corresponds to a number of battle cards. During a battle a battle card is first turned face up. Players can then participate in the battle with any knight cards that have any matching information to the battle card. These are played by a blind bidding mechanism. There are also some force cards that add to the total power of your knight cards. The player that plays the highest total power of knight cards wins the battle and claims the battle card. Only after the end of the tournament the players get to replenish their hands with new cards.

Name: Khan: The Golden Yurts
Description:
Promo expansion from Essen 2010.  From the package:

Instead of an ordinary yurt, each player may also place his Golden Yurt once per game.  If a conquer tile is built over this yurt, one yurt of the player in question is in any case (also) placed on the tile, regardless of which player has the majority.  The Golden Yurt is then put back into the box.

Name: Direct Hit
Description: A target game where bombs are loaded into a bomber and then dropped over a board in an attempt to hit the targets.  The game comes with a wood bomber and 4 plastic "bombs" with metal points on the tips of the bombs (similar to tips of darts).  A color lithograph board depicts topographical "targets" with various point values assigned to them.  Each player takes turns dropping their load of bombs on the board and scores points based on what targets they hit.  The game is not dated, but it may be post-WWII, perhaps in the 1950's.

Name: Yvio: Elefant, Tiger & Co.
Description:
From the box:
New Yvio game - Elephant, Tiger and Co. You need Yvio to play! Board game game console Yvio + ELEPHANT, TIGER & CO. Animal puzzle game for 1-4 children from 4 years and up. How loud a lion roars, beeps softly as the mouse? A cheetah sprints from 0 to 100 faster than a Formula 1 race car? The new Yvio game - Elephant, Tiger and Co. represents Yvio to the rising young with questions and makes the children go to the virtual zoo. If you know something or faster than others , Yvio will remember your points. Get most points and win the game.

Name: Jalgpall
Description:
From the rules:
Game comes with a board (football field), ball, 2 paws (goalies) and a dice.
The one who rolls the highest amount, will start from his side of the field. You move on elected paths and may move direction with dice rolls. When you land on opponents field, he will take now over and start attacking your goal. Same happens when you kick the ball out side the field. Same rules apply to the corner kick as well.
When attacker reaches the big space in front of the goal, defense players now first rolls the dice. When he rolls even number, he catches the ball, unless attacked rolls the same number. Then it is GOAL. When defender rolls odd number, it is instant goal.
When attacker reached big space little further from the goal with number 4 on it, attacker needs to roll 4 or higher to score from that place. To defend a kick from that place defender needs to roll higher than attacker.
Goals can be blocked with correct goalie placement.
How long the game lasts is determined before the game starts.

Name: Jäähoki
Description:
From the rules:
Game comes with game board (ice rink), 2 pawns and a dice. The regular pawns has black lines across them, which shows the movement direction.
In this ice hockey game, penguins and bears are competing against each other.
Blue squares are for penguins , yellow for bears and white are neutral.
Before rolling a dice you need to decide your direction, but be careful, because you do not want to go against the boards (lose the ball) nor you want to end your movement on the opponents square.
In front of each goal there are two circles that cover each 4 squares. These are places you can hit a goal. From yellow, you lose the ball, if you are blue player. From blue you hit a goal if goalie is set on blue as well. From white both players roll the dice. Higher wins and ties go to the attacker.
It is possible to score from the center of the field.
The game length is determined before the game starts.

Name: Мы по улице идём
Description:
From the rules:
Help Sascha move around the city safely. Move using correct traffic lights and laws.

Game is for 2-4 players and is played by drawing cards. Each card can go only one place at the time creating a pathway to your pawn. Get your pawn through the city first without getting hit by a car or violating any traffic related laws and win the game.

Name: Silver Stories
Description:
Silver Stories is a game similar to Black Stories. One player reads the riddle aloud from the front of the card. The other players try to guess what's happened. The answer stands on the back of the card and is only read by the storyteller.
Silver Stories' themes are aliens, weightlessness, space, and astronauts.

Name: Cocot Folie
Description:
From the box:
New children game where players all have to be chickens and peck grain. Just pull back you little chicken and let it do its work and eat that small ball.
Remember, it is not just eating everything, but eating right stuff and fast. Eat 6 blue when playing with blue chicken, all other ball through back in, when all balls are gone.
A neat little game for children. First one to collect 6 of their color balls, is the winner.

Name: Black Stories Junior: Yellow Stories
Description:
A game similar to Black Stories. One player reads the riddle in front of the card. The other players try to guess what's happened. The answer on the back of the card is read by the storyteller. The storyteller can only answer yes/no.
The Yellow Stoires are about the prairies, indians, cowboys and medicine men.

Name: Munchkin Quest: Promo Cards
Description:
User Summary

This is a catch-all entry for various Munchkin Quest promo cards that have been handed out at various cons, release events, and by MiB. Most of these cards are not released with any set and are/were only available as promotional items at events. The six hexahedron cards were included with the correspondingly colored Jumbo D6 Dice now OOP that SJG produced circa 2011.

Part of the Munchkin series

Name: Dicemants
Description:
Dicemants is a fast press-your-luck game where you must explore an old mine to find diamonds. Hidden in the sides of the 6 dices of the game there area void places, diamonds and dangers; you must decide if you go ahead and risk more and more to get as many gems as you can.

Game sequence
Each player rolls dices in turn; when he gets diamonds and voids he saves the diamond to his bag. Then he could continue rolling the void dices in order to get more treasures. But there are some events that can change his luck: there are bugs and thieves that steal fresh diamonds from the board or your bag. There are accidents like the TNT or the broken pick that leads you to roll again. And there is a deadly skull too...

The goal
Player must decide when is the best moment to stop rolling and count the catch of the turn. The goal is to be the first with 21 dices.

Name: Kings' Duel
Description:
Contents:
Instructions
Game board
4 sets of checkers (1 set each of red, blue, white, & black)
4 playing pieces with flags (1 each of red, blue, white, & black)
2 standard decks of playing cards

The game is played on a cross-shaped grid of five three-by-three blocks, with a 'king's space' at the terminal end of each branch.  The players each start on a branch of the cross by laying out 6 checkers and one horsemen (these 7 pieces are their knights) in the squares of the grid of their branch and their king's space. A player's turn consists of (1)drawing a card, (2)dueling another player's knight (optional), (3)turning in any pairs of cards you may have for more knights, and (4) moving any one knight to either an adjacent space or any available green space on the board, one of which allows a player to draw an extra card on their turn.

When a player starts a duel with another player, they each select a card from their hand, and higher card wins (king is high).  Ties are draws and both cards are discarded.  Re-dueling is optional. The winner draws a card from the draw pile AND takes both cards used in the duel (placed in 'pair's pile'), and loser removes their knight from the board.

Certain spaces on the board have numbers on them which require the attacker to play a card of that value or higher, while the defender may play any card value. Jokers may be played at any time to steal a random card from an opponent's hand.

After dueling, if you have any pairs (from either your hand or your 'pair's pile' ) you may turn as many as you wish in for more knights which are then placed in any space adjacent to another of your own knights.

Your goal is to have your knights occupying all four king spaces on the board.  You must always occupy at least one king space on the board, but not necessarily the one you started with.  If a person loses a duel for their last king space, all of their knights are removed from the board, and their cards are given to the winner of the duel.

Name: Munchkin: Go Up a Level
Description:
NOTE: Only those who own Munchkin games dated before April 2010 need to purchase this set. Games dated on/after April 2010 already include the cards from Munchkin: Go Up a Level.

After The Great 2010 Munchkin Changeover, the publisher didn't want to alienate its existing customer base by making them repurchase Munchkin games they already owned. So they released Munchkin: Go Up a Level, which contains just the changed cards.

Most, but not all of the updated cards are included. Significant exclusions are as follows:

    No monster enhancers were included even though they all changed.
    Only one Wandering Monster card was included, even though they all changed.
    Siege Engine from Munchkin 2: Unnatural Axe.
    Curse! Exploding Kneecaps from Munchkin 3: Clerical Errors.
    Grow Two Feet from Munchkin 5: De-Ranged
    Dungeon of Comprehensive Curses from Munchkin 6: Demented Dungeons.


				
				
					Publisher's Blurb (from the back of the box)Munchkin came out in 2001. Since then, we've published eight more core games and over a dozen expansion sets. We've learned a lot in the last nine years, and new printings of Munchkin and its sequels will change some cards for clarity or balance.

But we don't expect our fans to buy their Munchkin collection all over again. Instead, we created Munchkin: Go Up a Level. This box contains 132 updated cards from:

     Munchkin, Munchkin 2, Munchkin 3, Munchkin 4, Munchkin 5, and Munchkin 7
     Munchkin Blender
     Star Munchkin and Star Munchkin 2
     Munchkin Fu and Munchkin Fu 2
     Munchkin Bites! and Munchkin Bites! 2
     Super Munchkin and Super Munchkin 2
     Munchkin Impossible
     Munchkin Cthulhu, Munchkin Cthulhu 2, and Munchkin Cthulhu 3
     The Good, the Bad, and the Munchkin
     Munchkin Booty and Munchkin Booty 2


				
				
					OtherPart of the Munchkin series

Name: Abriss: Bunker tile
Description: Given out with copies of Abriss sold at Essen Spiel, this is an extra tile for the game. A Bunker, it is placed underneath a tile in play at the start of the game. When the building above is demolished, or at the last phase, it becomes available for destruction.

Name: Penguin Pick-Up
Description:
This set of oversized ( ) cards comes with instructions for several games:

Penguin Pick-Up: Players turn over the top card of their stack and the card with the most penguins wins the trick. Play continues until one player has captured all the cards.

Penguin Race: Each player is dealt 5 cards. The top card of the deck is turned over and players race to find a card in their hand that has the same number of penguins. The first player to get rid of all the cards in their hand wins.

Countin' Penguins: A player turns over a cards from the draw deck and counts the penguins. S/he continues turning over cards and adding penguins to the count until either a counting mistake is made or a Mother penguin card is turned up, at which point the player keeps all the cards turned up so far and play passes to the next player.  The player with the most cards when the draw deck is exhausted wins.

No More Penguins!: Each player starts with 5 cards. The top card of the deck is turned face up and players take turns playing a card that matches either the number of penguins or the color of scarf on the face up card. Anyone unable to play from their hand draws cards until a match is found.  The first person to play all their cards wins.

Penguin Memory: Cards are placed face down in a 4 x 10 matrix.  The player turns over any 2 cards. If the cards make a run (e.g., 2 & 3 penguins or 4 & 5 penguins), another card may be turned over.  The player continues to turn cards face up until one is found that does not continue the sequence. The player keeps the cards that formed the sequence and the next player takes his/her turn. The player with the most cards once all cards have been claimed is the winner.

{User Summary}

Name: Farben Domino
Description:
A card based domino games used to teach and reinforce color identification. Cards are placed with corresponding colors adjacent to one another. The first to place all the cards in their hand wins.

--user summary

Name: Lost Legacy
Description:
A fantasy themed customizable card game using a fixed distribution method.  In Lost Legacy you build a custom deck of 50 cards from a selection of character, item, counter, equipment, environment, weapon, and spell cards to challenge your opponent(s) on a modular game board.  The game incorporates elements from both CCGs and miniatures games (character cards are actually moved around the game board).  The object of the game is to acquire the most honor, honor can be acquired by destroying an opponents character during an attack, your opponent running out of cards in their deck, and having a character at certain locations on the game board.

Blurb from publisher's website:

Lost Legacy is a card game made by a small family owned company called Dreamastermind, Inc. located in Illinois.  It is a very strategic game designed to challenge players, but not their wallets.  In most card games, players must purchase multiple booster packs to acquire a couple random cards.  In Lost Legacy, players need only purchase one Expansion Set to acquire every card from that set!  This allows anyone to easily pick up on the game and build any deck they want without breaking the bank.

Name: KNOTZ!
Description:
An abstract strategy game for 2 players. 
This "cut-and-play" game was given out for free at the SPIEL 2010 in Essen, Germany, by the Österreichisches Spielemuseum (Austrian Games Museum).

Players start by taking turns populating a grid of connected spaces with their own tokens. When the board is completely full, the players take turns removing one of their own tokens one at a time. When a player's turn ends with one or more tokens isolated, i.e. not connected to any other tokens, those tokens are immediately removed as well. The first player with no tokens left on the board wins the game.

Name: Kleine Helden promo card "Dämonenschwert"
Description:
Promo weapon card for the card game "Kleine Helden" given out for free at the SPIEL 2010 in Essen.

Dämonenschwert means Demon Sword.

Name: Deadly Danger Dungeon
Description:
In Deadly Danger Dungeon, You play as a hapless treasure seeker who falls in a trap, landing in a ghastly dungeon full of unspeakable perils. The goal is to climb your way back out, but you will never make it without a long streak of lucky rolls. Anywhere you step, there is some kind of hazard that takes a health point away, or kills you instantly. It might be flying arrows, falling rocks, spikes, or a slide that sends you to a volcanic fire. You start with three health points but you can raise it if you find it too difficult. It doesn't matter anyways because so many spaces are instant death. It's not a linear game, you can't just go straight to the exit. First you have to get a talisman but before you get the talisman you need to get a key.

{Source: Deadly Danger Dungeon Video Review by James Rofle/Board James}

Name: Horse Racing Dice
Description:
Horse Racing Dice is a dice game using five special dice – a white handicap die, three red race dice and one hazard die. Players agree on the number of turns they will play, and on each turn a player rolls the handicap die first, then the three race dice. On the last turn, the players also roll the hazard dice. The handicap die has terms that add or subtract ‘lengths’ to or from a players roll (e.g. ‘on form’ adds a length, ‘off form’ subtracts a length). The race dice have numbers of lengths (also ‘necks’ which are worth a quarter length). The hazard die has hazards which subtract lengths or may even disqualify a player (e.g.  ‘lost whip’, ‘fall/object’). The player with the highest number of lengths when the race is completed wins.
The game comes in a pocket book-sized container with a scoring pad and pencil.

Name: Maria: Silesia Gambit
Description:
A one page extension for Richard Sivél's game Maria. According to the author, it extends the introductory game and it is designed for players who do not want to play with the complete expert rules, but who still want a more complex game experience.

The expansion was first introduced at the Spiel 2010 in Essen and is now available as a free download.
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession

Name: Cringle Bells
Description:
Cringle Bells is a game about Elves, specifically Santa's Elves. It is a game about these Elves working feverishly during the last 12 hours before Santa's sleigh leaves to deliver toys. Why 12 hours? Because Elves procrastinate. They know that the one who garners the most favor from Santa (points) gets to sit at the Big Man's table for after-Christmas dinner. They know that the one who garners the most favor from Santa is rewarded a 2-month vacation in Hawaii with any other Elf at the North Pole. And the most important thing of all? There's only one girl Elf, Gizelda in the doll wigs department (and she's the only Elf that's been to Hawaii EVERY YEAR!)

All you need is a pair of six-sided dice (you're not playing Monopoly that often, are you?), 1 deck of standard playing cards, the game rules, and scoresheets.

Players take turns attempting to complete the assembly of toys that are on the conveyor belt. They receive bonus points for dice combinations, completing a toy that their department specializes in (the same suit as their score sheet), and for completing the toy that their department makes all the time (a specific card).

It's a family game for 1 or more players and available free as a print and play game.

Who will become the Great Garbanzo and earn the most Favor? Most importantly, who will get to take the beautiful Gizelda to Hawaii?

Name: Let's Build a Village
Description:
Let's Build a Village is a cooperative game where players work together to clear the wilderness of monsters.  As areas are cleared, the players can build houses and sell the houses to villagers.  When the village is complete and all the player heroes are healed, the game ends.  The "winner" is considered to be the player having the most gold when the village is complete.

Players explore the wilderness by playing tiles.  Each tile has a monster that the player must fight to the death.  When four adjacent tiles are placed next to each other as a square, the player can build a house and attract villagers.  During a player's turn, the player can take three actions including moving tile to tile to explore, digging for gold, building a house, selling a house to a village, or healing wounds.

Let's Build a Village represents an game improvised on the fly by a seven year old girl.  She invented the game because she had left over 1" x 1" ceramic tiles from a second grade project.  Naturally, Dad helped a bit.

Name: Skulduggery Pleasant Game Cards
Description:
From the back of the slipcase:
"Challenge your friends to supernatural duels with exclusive Skulduggery Pleasant game cards!  Pit your wits and use battle skills to fight with characters old and new, including unseen secret info on villains from the third Skulduggery adventure!"

Comes in a slipcase "Battle Pack" with a trade paperback of the first Skulduggery Pleasant book.  Made for sale in the UK.

From the "How to Play" card:

"2-4 players

1. Shuffle and deal all cards face down in stacks.
2. Each player holds their cards so that they can only see the first card in their stack.
3. The player to the left of the dealer chooses a category from their upturned card to do battle with e.g. Adept Magic.
4. The other players take turns to read out the score for this category on their upturned card.
5. The player with the highest score wins this round and places all the upturned cards including their own to the bottom of the pile.
6. The winner then chooses a category from their next card to start a new round.
NB. If two or more cards in a round share the top score then all the cards are placed in the middle and a new round is started (by the same player as before).  The winner of this round takes the cards in the middle too.
7. The person with all the cards at the end of the game is the winner.
Optional extra rule:  Once a player is down to only three cards, they may look at all three and choose which to play."

Art by Tom Percival.

Name: Kaboom!
Description:
This game has been published by dV Giochi as a reward for winning the 2009/2010 edition of the Gioco Inedito – Best Unpublished game contest. Powered by Lucca comics & Games and dV Giochi, the contest aims to identify the best new card game design from all prototypes received and to reward it by publishing the game in a fully professional and high-quality format, overseen directly by dV Giochi. All prototypes submitted must conform to the technical and style requirements, fixed components and a given theme which changes every year. Everybody can join the contest and this is a great opportunity for emerging game designers to see their idea published.
For more information:
giocoinedito@luccacomicsandgames.com
www.luccacomicsandgames.com

User Summary

Players try to defuse a bomb by figuring out which wires to cut. The game ends when someone decides to defuse the bomb or when the timer runs out. The player who correctly defuses the bomb is the winner but if the bomb explodes, the player with the most agents out of the building wins.

Name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Last Fight
Description:
"Last Fight" is tactical space combat game based on Japanese TV animation series "Mobile Suit Gundam".

Each unit represent one humanoid weapons called mobile suits(MS). Unit ability isn't mentioned on the unit, and it is on the data cards.

Each player control one or few MS and aims at the destruction of the opponent's MS.

Players writes down the plan of the movement and the battle in the log. Then, that is disclosed and resolve at simultaneous. The law of the inertia acts on the movement in the outer space.

Name: Ghosts of Iga
Description:
Ghosts of Iga is a twenty-card expansion pack to be played along with the card and dice game ‘Seppuku’.  This set introduces Shinobi (ninja) and their tactics.  Iga was a province in feudal Japan and is considered the birthplace of the ninja.

The expansion pack consists of (20) cards.  There are (4) Shinobi, (10) Tactics (3) Armaments, and (3) Action Cards.

Name: Wizard Extreme: Revolution promo card
Description:
Promo card given out for free at Essen 2010.

The card is shuffled into the normal playing deck. A player who plays the Revolution card must immediately declare a new trump suit. The card itself has a value of 0 and is colourless, so it cannot win any tricks.

Name: Le Havre: Le Grand Hameau – Rattletrap car
Description:
The Rattletrap car card is a special promo card for Le Havre: Le Grand Hameau. The card has the number GH31.

This card is included in the 2017 edition of Le Havre.

Description of the card:

The Rattletrap car must be taken by the next player getting at least 1 Iron (not Steel).  The Rattletrap car cannot be sold.

Name: Le Havre: Le Grand Hameau – Wholesale Bakery
Description:
The Wholesale Bakery card is a special promo card for Le Havre: Le Grand Hameau. The card has the number GH32.

This card is included in the 2017 edition of Le Havre.

Description of the card:

The player may use the Wholesale Bakery to sell any number of bread for 2 francs each.

Name: Agricola: The Legen*dairy Forest Deck – Chuck the Wood Chuck
Description:
Chuck the Wood Chuck is a special promo card from the SPIEL 10 in Essen and expands the Agricola The Legen*dary Forest Deck.

Description of the card:

Whenever Chuck the Wood Chuck would chuck wood, Chuck chucks more wood.

If an action gives you wood as the only resource, you get 1 more wood.

Name: Pajęczyna
Description:
A two player board game for kids 9 years and up.
Game includes a spider-web board and 6 pawns (5 spiders and 1 fly) 
Game consists of subsequent player turns where one of the players controls the fly and the another - spiders. The fly is placed in the middle of the board (indicated by the red circle) and the spiders in the blue ones on the edge of the board. One of the blue circles should remain empty. Fly moves first.
Player moves the fly to any empty adjacent circle. However he cannot return to the red circle. Spiders move to any empty adjacent circle.
The player controlling the fly wins when he/she reaches one of the blue circles on the edge of the board and loses when gets surrounded by spiders.

Name: Crowns
Description:
Crowns is an abstract strategy board game, like chess, go, or stratego. Crowns is what you’d get if you tried to cram a wargame into a chess board.

Players select their starting pieces from 3 tiers of units and sets up behind a divider. After both players have set up, the divider is removed and the game is played with perfect information.

The goal of the game is to capture the opponent's crown -- a piece analogous to the king in chess, but unable to capture.

Each player selects 8 bottom-tier units, 4 mid-tier units, and 1 top-tier unit, for a total of 14 pieces including the crown. All pieces have movement limitations and most have special rules including shooting and continuing to move after capturing.

Crowns is played on a 9x9 grid; each player has 3 home rows and there are three rows of no-man's-land. It has a historical military theme: units include archers, cavalry and men-at-arms.

Name: Extra Impetus 3
Description:
Third expansion 'magazine' for Impetus and Basic Impetus wargame rules. Includes 46 official army lists and 2 campaign games. Also a tutorial on zones of control and visibility, and further amendments.

Armies included are for the following eras:
Italy in the 15th Century
Europe in the 15th Century
The Wars of the Roses
The Ottoman Empire

Name: Black Jack Dice
Description:
This is a dice game in Onsworld's Jackpot Dice series.
The game comes with five special dice that show an Ace, deuce, four, eight ten and Jack. There are also cards showing each of these denominations and four cards showing pay-offs.

A player takes on the role of banker and hands a die to another player to cast. After rolling the first die, that player decides how much to bet and subsequently decides whether to roll more dice, one by one, attempting to come as close to a total of twenty-one but not exceeding it. If he exceeds twenty-one the banker takes the player's stake, but if he stops below twenty-one, the banker then rolls two dice and attempts to beat or equal the player's roll. If the banker fails to equal the roll or goes bust, the player wins the appropriate amount as indicated on the cards.

Optionally, the players may play with side bets. For this purpose, the other cards showing card faces are laid out and players may bet on these faces appearing on the dice for each roll of the dice.

The instructions mention that other games in the Jackpot Dice series include Clipper, Crown and Anchor, Liar and Crossword Dice.

Name: Perfect Picnic
Description:
Throw the die and be the first to fill your rug with a complete set of picnic items.

Each player takes it in turn to throw the die. If you throw a six, you take a rug; if you throw any other number before getting your picnic rug you pass. Once you have your picnic rug, you take the other pieces as follows. When you throw:
One - a bottle of pop
Two - a sandwich 
Three - a piece of cake
Four - an apple
Five - sausage roll
Six - pass

If you throw a number you do not need, for example, two, when you already have a sandwich, then you must pass. The first player to complete their rug and make the Perfect Picnic wins the game.

Similar to Jumbolino and Cootie

Name: OPFOR Insurgency
Description:
Publisher information

The world is full of perfect havens for insurgents. They hide in the jungles, mountains, and even the cities.OPFOR Insurgency is third in the companies "10 Minute War Game" series and includes the Jungle, Mountain, and City editions. 
    
As the Blufor (US) you have intelligence units, air and artillery support, and your allies to help find and destroy a High Value Target (HVT) before it disappears.
    
As the OPFOR you have the advantage of restricted terrain, IEDs, ambushes, and engineering obstacles to delay or destroy units searching for you. 
    
To play, the OPFOR places cards,including the HVT, facedown in a 5X5 pattern.  The Blufor has 3 turns of 3 moves to uncover the hidden OPFOR cards, find and destroy the HVT with his units.

The game was designed by Steve Pearson, a member of the World Class OPFOR, Ft. Leavenworth, Kansas.

Name: Zombie Tide: Road to Hope
Description:
In Zombie Tide: Road to Hope, players must explore a ruined city, scavenging fuel, food, ammo, and equipment in an attempt to survive roaming zombie hordes and arrive safely at the Military Base where rescue awaits.

Cash in fuel chips to move, spend ammo to fend off zombies, and collect equipment to bolster your attacks and defenses.

Running out of food, ammo, or fuel could be disastrous, as infection sets in, leading to madness and eventual transformation into a zombie!

Name: Sbronzopoli
Description: Sbronzopoli (where "sbronza" means to get plastered) is an alcoholic roll-and-move party game for adults, inspired by Monopoly. Here you move your pawn towards the goal, drinking at almost each step of your path.

Name: 2012: The Day of Fallout – Commander
Description:
2012: The Day of Fallout - Commander
Free, tactical board game for 2 players (print and play)

Lead one of two armies: Human Section 8 and Arkanian alien race. Fight for domination over the Last District on Earth.

Section 8 is last hope of mankind, has powerful offensive units. Arkanians - insectoid invaders form space with heavily armoured units trying to take over the earth.

Phases of game:
- draw to 3 cards on hand
- recruit units
- realize special missions
- move units on board
- attack
- Victory Points counting

Victory is achieved by:
- collecting victory point's
- destruction of all enemy unit's on board
- winning three of the four opponent fields (starting field's)

Game in Polish and English language version.

Name: Inspecteur Lénigme
Description:
Two teams compete to solve enigmas writen upon cards. The less clues you use, the more points you score. A magnifying glass serves to reveal the anwers as well as a scoring pad.

Contents:
- A book of rules
- A big magnifying glass 
- 75 cards printed on both sides (for a total of 150 enigmas to solve)

Name: Outnumbered!
Description:
Outnumbered is a question and answer game that requires quick thinking and a little bit of luck!

What year did the Berlin Wall come down? Number of Van Gogh’s ears? Not only do you have to be the first person to answer the question correctly but you must have the dice to match! Players take turns reading and answering questions. Each player rolls their own set of dice using the numbers rolled to answer the questions. Correctly answered questions earn points; some are harder and award more points than others. Be the player with the most points to win!

With 750 questions and 60 dice

(from Manufacturer's site)

Name: Number Ninjas!
Description:
Ninjas prepare to be challenged! The Golden Dragon has been discovered and you must be the first to reach its location. To reach the ancient artifact, each ninja will have to travel through four areas: a bamboo forest, an ancient Japanese village, the cave of elders and a koi pond. To move throughout these locations, ninja players roll one of two sets of dice and solve the number challenge rolled.

The skill level of each player determines which set of dice that ninja will use  the basic set of dice includes addition and subtraction; the advanced set of dice includes addition, subtraction and multiplication. In each of the four locations, ninjas will solve a word challenge, once all four challenges have been successfully completed, the ninja player makes his way to the Golden Dragon and the win!

But don’t be fooled, the life of a ninja is never as easy as it looks, while moving throughout the lands other ninjas will try to trap you and block your way to the Golden Dragon, you must defend yourself while using your smarts and turn the traps on them!

The box includes: 3 Ninja Recruit dice, 3 ninja master dice, game board, 4 ninja pawns, 12 quest items, 3 traps, the Golden Dragon, 80 ninja challenge cards, and EASY to follow rules!

Name: Action Princesses
Description:
Choose your Action! Princess and get ready for an exciting adventure as you rescue Prince Simpleton!

On your way to save the Prince, you must conquer the Forest of Spelling, the Bog of Numbers, Triviaville, the Ancient Maze, and the action-packed Action Cave!

Action! Princesses features word and number play, trivia for girls, physical challenges, a dry-erase game board, and a TON OF DICE!

What's in the box?
8 letter dice, 5 spot dice, 1 JUMBO die, 3 number dice, Game Board, Four Princess Pawns, Dry Erase Marker, 40 Action Cave cards, 40 Triviaville cards, 50 Story cards,
and EASY-TO-FOLLOW rules!

(from Manufacturer's Site)

Name: Santa's Workshop Disaster
Description:
After 3000 years of restless retirement, batty old elf Willy McWindup is suddenly called in to perform Head Elf duties amidst a wild case of snowball fever sending all of Santa's remaining Head Elves to bed rest.  With mere days before Christmas Eve and piles of presents yet to construct, you must reign in old Willy's outrageous ideas and convince him to green light and produce your concepts to help save christmas.


Santa's Workshop Disaster is a quick family holiday themed card game for 2-6 Players, the more the merrier!  It plays similar to Apples to Apples, using funny and disgusting combinations of IDEA and CONCEPT Cards, which together represent a finished present yet to be constructed. Taking turns playing the Head Elf, you draw an IDEA card and (reading aloud) present it on the table.  Helper Elves (the remaining players) then choose a CONCEPT card that they feel best matches the IDEA card.  Receiving the cards face down, the Head Elf then shuffles and (reading aloud) presents the CONCEPTS on the table.  Using ANY criteria, the Head Elf then chooses which Combination of IDEA and CONCEPT to green light and send to production - thus scoring one point towards the win for the player whose CONCEPT was chosen.  Roles then rotate around the table until there is a winner with the most CONCEPTS chosen (rules vary based on number of players).  


Santa's Workshop Disaster is a Free Print and Play designed by Monster Make.108 Cards, all files provided in High Resolution, including Rules and Tuck Box.

Currently files can be found HERE.

It is a large file (240MB) consisting of 14 pages of 8.5x11 (Letter) Cards with 9 cards to a page.  It also contains 1 page of 8.5x11 PocketMod layout Rules, and 2 pages of 8.5x14 (Legal) Tuckbox layouts. 
 The files will eventually be loaded into the Database, but for now can be found at the above link!

Included is alternate rules for 2 players with the addition of A,B,C cards and a version for young (3+ years) players.


Thanks, hope you enjoy!!
Stephen - Monster Make

Name: Rölli: Nurinkurinen noppapeli
Description:
Finnish children's character Rölli and his friends walk in the Rölli forest, trying to stay in the forest as long as possible.

Players roll dice and move their characters accordingly, gaining action cards. The cards help characters to stay in the forest longer. The winner is the last character still in the forest.

Actions in the cards: 5 steps back, 10 steps back, roll dice to step back, stop current move, everyone else roll dice to move forward.

Name: Skreemer
Description:
Welcome to Skreemer, a game of future hovercar racing for 2 - 10 players. 
The game is based on the popular Wipeout computer games, and has tight bends, speed-up’s and of course....missiles to slow down your opponents.

The simple rule set allows players hovercars to use a speedometer to accelerate round the track. Moving over speed-ups will propel you forward. Moving over weapon pods will equip your car with rockets to slow your opponents down. Hits are calculated on a very simple dice throw. The winner is the player to cross the chequered flag after the final lap.

Name: Christmas Spirit
Description:
It's that time of year! The air has gotten crisp and the elves are working overtime to ensure Santa's sleigh is ready to go on the big night! And boy have there been a lot of orders this year! From iPlods to Zebras (with Real Exploding Action), children's wish lists have gotten increasingly lengthy and complex!

This year, the big cheese himself has decided to bring in some migrant elves to help with demand. He even gave them their own factory floors and access to the common area! Needless to say, The pointy eared members of Christmas local #127 have become fearful of replacement if they fall behind on this year's manufacturing.

In Christmas spirit, players take control of one of the groups of elves competing to create toys for Santa's winter ride. The object of the game is to create more, better toys than the rival groups. The player with the most victory points in toy cards in Santa's sleigh at the end of the game is the winner and has a little job security for next year.

Name: Trenchzone Expansion: Tactical Advantage
Description:
Tactical Advantage is an expansion deck of cards that can be used in part or whole to enhance 'Trenchzone' the game.

This expansion contains:

1 Clear Plastic Box
1 Front Cover Card
1 Rule Card
4 Decoy Cards
36 Unique Tactical Advantage Cards
12 Blank Cards for you to create your own optional Tactical Cards

(Updated with one new advantage card 03/11/11)
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Alligator Dice Game
Description:
This is a game in Koplow's series of dice games that come in a tube and which usually feature dice where one side is replaced with a graphic of animal. In this case, you get five dice where the the one-pip is replaced with a graphic of an alligator.

The game is a simple dice rolling game - players roll the dice and need at least one alligator before they can score, They can set aside one alligator and other dice showing pipped sides which give the score - the other dice can be re-rolled once to attempt to improve the score. The player then decides whether to increase the size of their 'gator' by rolling all five dice and adding the sum of pipped dice to their score; however on this subsequent roll, any alligators rolled count as minus five points.

The player with the highest number of points after all the rolling wins.

Name: D-Day
Description:
This is operational level wargame based on Invasion Normandy. Small size and easy rule game.
It is mostly called "SS D-Day" because there are many games of the same name.

The Allied player aims at a success of the landing operations. The German player aims at the obstruction of the Allied Forces.  Each game turn is divided into three impulse. The number of times that it can be activated by the unit is different.

This game was first published as one of the Series: SS (Sho-Kikaku).
Republished in Command Magazine Japan #46 in 2002, along with The Battle of the Bulge: Panzers in the Snow.

Name: All Time 9
Description:
All Time 9 is a baseball board game that includes 160 of some of the all time great players in baseball history.  
The statistical accuracy of the game lets players play out games using these all time greats from every era, up to the modern age of baseball.

The mechanic that sets it apart is the initial rolling of dice by the player controlling the pitcher, with a follow-up dice roll by the batter, in response to what the pitcher did.  This accurately recreates the pitcher/batter duel, as opposed to other baseball boardgames that resolves all action in a single dice roll, with no input from one or the other of the 2 players involved.

Name: Yonin Shogi
Description:
Yonin Shogi or Four-handed Shogi is a four-player variant of shogi invented in 1993 but published in its current form in 1995.

The game is played using two subsets of standard shogi pieces and a standard 9x9 shogi board. Each of the four players gets one king, one rook, two gold generals, two silver generals, and three pawns.

The players sit around the board, one at each of the four sides. At start, each player's pieces are arranged in three rows forming a triangular pattern centered along the respective edge of board:

The objective of the game is to capture your opponents' kings. Individual play as well as team play is possible. Movement and capture are identical to standard shogi, except for check and checkmate.

Name: Disassemblin' Dice
Description:
Disassemblin' Dice is a dice game for 2-4 players using the Nestortiles game system.  In Disassemblin' Dice, players build dice using Nestortiles, roll those dice to score points, and then disassemble and re-assemble the dice in order to create more powerful dice.  Rolling a higher score than the other players allows a player to push their opponents' dice markers towards the end of the disassembly track.  Once a player is knocked off the track, their die is disassembled, and they are out of the game.  The last player to have their die disassembled wins.

Each tile that a player uses to assemble their dice changes the score that any roll yields.  Players must carefully remove and add different tiles to their dice in order to maximize their chances of scoring higher than their opponents.  Careful manipulation of the six Nestortiles and a bit of luck result in victory!

Name: Sink it
Description:
Early variation of the battleship type game.

ships noted are BB CA and DD's

Each ship generates a different number of shots and when the ship is sunk the player reduces the number of shots he takes.

Ship locations are noted on the pad and each turns shots are noted by turn. This creates a record of the game played.

The game appears to be a promotional item of the Krueger Brewing comapany. They closed their doors in 1961.

owner description:

Name: Discretion
Description:
This game is from Volume Sprayer Mfg Co of Tulsa Oklahoma and was produced in 1942.

The game comes with money in 1,000, 500,100,and 50 dollar denominations, 36 yellow and green combination cards and 36 red and black combination cards. The game also has 2 Dudecahedron dice (12 sided)

All of the number combination cards are placed face down and each player draws a card and places it face up. The first player  decides if he  is rolling red or yellow. The dice are then rolled and anyone who has a card showing on the table with the combination that has been rolled wins. If no one wins then they all keep the first card and turn over another one. The player must always declare the color that he is rolling. The accumulated cards that you have increases the payoff if you have a winning card.  (you hold 6 cards, 4 red and 2 yellow. The roller declares Red and rolls a 3 and a 9. One of your red cards has that 3 and 9 grouping so you win the value of the roll times 4 for the number of red cards that you have.

A time limit is suggested as to when the game ends.

Name: Six Shooter
Description: Six Shooter is a fun, fast-paced, easy to learn dice game where all players play at the same time. Each player rolls 6 dice and attempts to complete the goal on the current card. The first player to get 6 in a row on their board wins!

Name: A Fistful of Tripods
Description:
A Fistful of Tripods is a set of miniatures war game rules that cover the Marian invasion described by H. G. Wells in his novel "War of the Worlds".

Players can re-create the first "historical" Martian invasion of 1890's (which was an all out rout of the humans), or play one of several alternate scenarios from the 1920's through the 1990's.

The rules are based on the Fistful of TOWS miniatures rule set.

This description is paraphrased from the introductory section of the rulebook.
Families: Books: The War of the Worlds

Name: Skryptorium
Description:
We invite you into middle ages where in scriptorium (latin for "a place for writing") Benedictine monks would copy and illustrate books and manuscripts. Your task in the game is to help the scribe to collect sentences that were scattered through out the monastery. The player, who will collect the most complete sentences and will deliver them to scriptorium will be a winner. Game combines spin and move with classic memory mechanic adding some special twists into the mix.

Game presents Christian spirituality and sentences of st. Benedictine. "Skryptorium" was prepared in cooperation with Benedictine monastery in Tyniec, Poland.

Name: Capt'n Sharky: Ab auf die Palme
Description:
Capt'n Sharky and his friends have discovered a new island. Right in the center of it, Sharky sees a large palm with many of coconuts. The friends decide to pick them off, but watch out - upwards is not the only way!

An exciting contest is about to start - who will reach the top first and pick the biggest coconut.

Players draw cards, showing which two characters they support. These Cards are kept hidden. 
Each Player has a set of cards, allowing him to move various characters up and down the tree. The goal is to collect the most valuable coconuts with the own characters without being identified by the others, what would enable them to play negative cards on the right target. The player who's characters have collected the most valuable coconuts at the end of the game wins.

Name: Owlman
Description:
An asymmetric strategy game based on Britain’s answer to the West Virginia Mothman sightings. The game can be played using pieces from a chess and checkers set.  Owlman is an abstract strategy game with unequal forces, based on a loose theme of cryptozoological investigation.

The Owlman side has just one piece (a black knight) which starts in the upper left corner. Doc's side has Doc (a white king starting in the lower right corner) and 12 helpers (checkers starting near Doc).

Owlman's main objective is to frighten all of Doc's helpers out of the woods. Doc aims to reach the Owlman's lair (the upper left corner), along with one of his helpers (adjacent to the corner), who will help him set up his "cryptozoological" camera.

The game is played in alternating turns, moving pieces on the 8x8 board. All pieces can step to an adjacent space. Only Owlman can capture, by stepping toward a helper, who is then frightened out of the woods. Owlman also has a special "swoop" move (like an elongated knight's move, but 4x2 instead of 3x2).

Name: Ora et Labora
Description:
"Ora et Labora" is Latin for for pray and work is a principle of the Benedictine monasteries. In this game players are young helpers arriving to the monastery to learn about the life of Benedictine monks. This can be done by completing tasks (that ask players to collect sets of cards like writing materials, sentences etc.). Board presents a clock with main activities of the monastery (like prayers, work in the scriptorium or in the garden) and players can can choose in which of the shortly starting activities they want to participate (represented by them moving pawn on board). Next the player can use the ability of the field he moved to (drawing card, exchanging card with a common poll, completing tasks etc.). Each completed task gives a player certain amount of points and allows him or her to draw another task card. Game follows this pattern until one of the players collect enough points.

Game presents Christian spirituality and sentences of st. Benedictine. "Skryptorium" was prepared in cooperation with Benedictine monastery in Tyniec, Poland

Name: Galactic Frontier
Description:
From the designer.

The year is 2382 and the Milky Way Galaxy is teeming with life.  The petty intra-planetary squabbles of the last millennium have given way to the hustle and bustle of interstellar commerce and entrepreneurship.  Can you compete in the 24th Century?  Play Galactic Frontier and see if you have what it takes!

Players select unique races (variable player powers) and set out to be the most successful entrepreneurs in the Milky Way.  Players use influence markers to stake claim to resources and to keep their opponents at bay.  By carefully managing their research efforts in 8 unique fields, players gain access to more advanced technology.  The player who earns the most victory points by delivering rare minerals, advancing up the technology ladders, and avoiding the pesky space pirates will be the winner.

Name: Non-Stop
Description:
A pure dice rolling two player game. To win the game, a player must be the first one to have all numbers from 1 to 10 either marked or locked. Two dice is used to hit the numbers. A turn, ie. rolling the dice, continues as long as results of both dice (individual results or their sum) can be used in actions.

The actions are:-
 1 mark own unmarked number,  or
 2 unlock(mark) own locked number,  or
 3 unmark the other player's marked number

At the beginning of a turn, a player is supposed lock all his remaining marked numbers (that the other player has not managed to unmark on his turn). During a turn, a player has an option to unlock some of these numbers (depending on the dice results), but can decide to not do so.

Name: Quiz!: Tack för att du visar leg.
Description:
A simple quiz game with cards. All in all the game comes with 160 questions in various topics.

No rules are included, other than that you play to 15 points.

Name: Chaos Isle: Heroes of Chaos Isle
Description:
Heroes of Chaos Isle is a promo set of 6 brand new Characters for Chaos Isle: Zombi Deck. Featuring all new art by artist Beth Hancock and with an all new card design, the cards are printed on 4" x 6" card stock. You can get a great visual of your remaining life as you place tokens on your character on the new Hit icons. You can even mark off your hits using a dry erasable marker. This all new promo character set is available exclusively from the Board Game Geek store.

Requires the original Chaos Isle: Zombi Deck core game to play.

Disgusting Fact: the Hit icons on the cards were generated from real blood. Yummy.

Name: Ascension: Theme Pack – Rat King
Description:
Ever felt like the Cultist needed some help taking care of those bullies who keep picking on him? Now he has it! Rat King adds a whole new dimension to monsters in Ascension! While up until now monsters have impacted the game only by providing a reward to the player who defeats them, the Rat King leads his hordes of Giant Rat minions to swarm all over the center row and wreak havoc on the best laid plans. In game terms, the Rat King cards are shuffled into the center deck, while the Giant Rats are placed on the side. When the Rat King shows up in the center row, cover every other card with a Giant Rat. Players need to defeat these rats — or the King himself — before being able to get to the other cards.

Ascension: Theme Pack – Rat King comes with two copies of the Rat King and ten Giant Rats, enough for the rodent infestation to strike twice in a single game!

Name: Le Super Morpion Tournant
Description:
Le Super Morpion Tournant (The Great Turning Tic Tac Toe) is a "tri-dimensional turning tactical game" according to the label on the side of the game box. The game is 3D four-in-a-row game with some distinct differences from the common forms such as Score Four:

The game is for two or four players.
 The game box contains a brief rule sheet in French, a game board, and 64 beads in four colors, 16 of each color.
 The middle of the game board consists of a four by four array of 16 rods, the central four of which are placed on a turntable. Thus, the central four rods may be turned relative to the board. In the periphery of the game board is space for an additional 16 rods which may be arranged in the corners (four player game) or along the ends (two player game). Each rod is able to contain a stack of four beads.

At the beginning of the game each player starts out with 32 beads, eight of each color (two player game) or 16 beads, for of each color (four player game). All of beads are positioned at the peripheral rods at start.

On turn, each player is either placing one of his/her beads on one of the 16 central rods on the game board, or turning the central plate 90 degrees clockwise.

The objective of the game is to create alignments of four different colored beads. Each such alignment earns the player one point. The player with most points at the end of the game (when all the beads have been played) is the winner.

Name: SUWS/NSUWS
Description:
SUWS/NSUWS is a simple introductory system which allows to simulate land and naval battles mainly during the pre-gunpowder era.

It is easy to understand and play and players must face the same problems of their historic counterparts, finding some battles very hard to win, and to lose, or very slow or fast, finding themselves in the same climax of the leaders which fought hundreds of years ago.

The game includes:

Two set of rules, basic, for easy introduction, and advanced, for a deeper game.

Two scenarios books including naval and land  battles ranging from ancient Greek and Roman era to European medieval and to Japan civil war; covering battles never simulated before like Al-Qadisiyyah or Dan-No-Ura.

Each battle has its own map (of a standard size) and includes advanced and special rules if needed.

More than 1,000 front-back easy-to-understand counters including Leaders, infantry, cavalry, archers, ships and other units with unique symbols based on era and geographic area, European and eastern, of all forces involved.

Charts and table.

The game is open to suggestions, new ideas and scenarios, and a blank map and blank counter sheet is included to help in development.

Actually the game is in Italian tongue only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

Name: SPAZIO PROFONDO/OUTER SPACE
Description:
SPAZIO PROFONDO/OUTER SPACE is a science fiction game of exploration, colonization, war and conquest in deep space; it is a cross-over of the first edition of Twilight Imperium and of Conquest of Paradise from GMT taking elements from both.

It is a fast and easy game to play and learn, it is good to introduce new players to wargames or for a one-session evening.

The game includes:

    Easy to understand Rules
    240 Megahexes used to build the map
    Nearly 800 front-back counters including troops, colonies, planetary defences, warships, explorer and more
    27 Random events cards
    Charts and tables for easy play
    The game system is based on Kevin McPartland Conquest of Paradise (GMT) fantastic game.


Currently the game is in Italian only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

Name: E ADESSO?!/AND NOW?!
Description:
E ADESSO?!/AND NOW?! is an economic-oriented game inspired to Role-Playing Games, what future awaits an old sorcerer, fighter, paladin etc. after their retirement?

How they invest their gold pieces and how they maintain their glory and fame?

In E ADESSO?!/AND NOW?! 3-6 players are ex-adventures whose, once retired, are trying to invest their gold, trying go to become more and more famous and to climb social hierarchy and now, becoming older, they need the services of young adventures.

To reach their targets now they must buy land, build manors, trying to attract people and build a little village, engage young adventurers to defend their proprieties, and defend themselves from any kind of bureaucracy, an hard work, the main challenge must still start…

The game includes:

    Easy to understand Rules
    Map of a city and surrounding area
    Counters including gold, adventures, manors and more.
    Charts and tables for easy play.
    The game system is based on “Metropolis” (Editoy) game.


Actually the game is in Italian only.

The game is totally free and all files needed to print & play are included here.

Designer     Gian Carlo Porciani
Artist             Gian Carlo Porciani

Name: Catan Scenarios: Helpers of Catan
Description: Catan Scenarios: Helpers of Catan – a mini-expansion for CATAN that's compatible with CATAN: Seafarers and both Catan: 5-6 Player Extension and Catan: Seafarers â€“ 5-6 Player Extension – consists of ten character cards, each of which has a different special ability that the player can use once or twice before trading for another. For example, Marianne lets you take any one resource card if you rolled something other than a 7, but didn't get resources from that roll. As each player builds her second settlement, she takes a specific card based on player order, with approximate utility increasing to help combat earlier player advantage. A player must use her card's ability before she may turn it in, but she may choose which card to take, adding a level of strategy.

Name: Dragon Flight
Description:
Dragon Flight is a racing game for 2-4 players.

Using strategy and luck, players must race their dragons across a modular map, avoiding obstacles and attacks from their competitors.

On each turn players use hand cards to enable their dragon to fly at defined speeds and altitude across a modular hex map, containing obstacles of various heights, namely floating mountains.

Race your dragons through the rings, placed at various height weigh points and back home again, making best use of your cards and the available thermals (up-drafts and down-drafts) to gain and lose height.  Attack your enemies with powerful flame attacks and force them to lose control.

Name: Paranoia
Description:
